original: Aartelo, Osrik, komminister, Aske-ryds kyrkby, f. 23/7/00 i Kirvu, Finl. G. 26 m. Olga Elisabet Johnsson. — Stud:ex. i Björneborg 19, teol. fil. ex. i Lund 28, teol. kand., prakt. teol. prov samt prästv. f. Linköp. stift 33. Tjg. i Norrköp. norra församl.. Djurs-dala, Mjölby, Hallingeberg, Blackstad, Locknevi, Hjorted o. Krrstdala, v. p^astor i Landeryd, kommin. i Aske-ryd sed. 41. Ordf. i kyrkostämxma o. skoliS’tyr. FMMlkl, MannerheimM.
translated: Aartelo, Osrik, minister, Aske-ryd village, born July 23, 1900 in Kirvu, Finland. Married to Olga Elisabet Johnsson on June 26. He completed his high school studies in Björneborg in 1919, theological studies in Lund in 1928, and received a theological degree and practical theological examination before becoming a priest in Linköping Diocese in 1933. He served in the parishes of Norrköp. Norra församl, Djurs-dala, Mjölby, Hallingeberg, Blackstad, Locknevi, Hjorted, and Krrstdala, as well as being a vicar in Landeryd and a minister in Aske-ryd since 1941. He is also the Chairman of the church council and the school board. Awarded the Finnish MannerheimM medal.
